meanings.definition: Vamoses: third person singular present tense of the verb 'vamose'
meanings.sent1: She vamoses to the store every day.
meanings.sent2: He always vamoses to school early.
meanings.sent3: The cat vamoses around the house chasing shadows.
meanings.sent4: Time vamoses away like a fast train.
meanings.sent5: The wind vamoses through the trees, rustling the leaves.

meanings.definition: Vamoses: plural form of the noun 'vamos'
meanings.sent1: The group of friends made plans for their vamoses.
meanings.sent2: The vamoses of birds in the sky were a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The vamoses of colorful balloons filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The vamoses of students in the hallway created a buzz of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The vamoses of waves crashing on the shore was calming.

meanings.definition: Vamoses: present participle of the verb 'vamose'
meanings.sent1: They are vamoses to the party right now.
meanings.sent2: The children were vamoses around the playground happily.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were vamoses up and down the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The cars were vamoses along the highway in a rush.
meanings.sent5: The river was vamoses swiftly downstream after the rain.
